people.name: Martin H. Glynn
people.description: Martin Henry Glynn  was an American politician.  He was the 40th Governor of New York from 1913 to 1914, the first Irish American Roman Catholic head of government of what was then the most populated state of the United States.

items.name: Oklahoma Indian Welfare Act
items.description: It is a photograph about Oklahoma Indian Welfare Act. In a corner, it says:The Oklahoma Indian Welfare Act of 1936  is a United States federal law that extended the 1934 Wheeler-Howard or Indian Reorganization Act to include those tribes within the boundaries of the state of Oklahoma.   There are things written behind: Oklahoma Elmer Thomas Democratic Party (United States)  And the following place: Valatie, New York
